sen.j: 粕屋 十郎（かすや じゅうろう、天保11年（1840年） - 明治2年5月11日 (旧暦)（1869年6月20日））は、幕末期の幕臣で、武蔵国江戸出身の回天隊隊士。
sen.e: Juro Kasuya (1840 - June 20, 1869) was a Shogun's retainer in the end of Edo period and a member of Kaitentai from Edo, Musashi Province.
Juro KASUYA (1840 - June 20, 1869) was a Shogun's retainer in the end of Edo period and a member of Kaitentai from Edo, Musashi Province.
sen.cmt: Kasuya を大文字に変更しました。
sen.e: Juro KASUYA (1840 - June 20, 1869) was a Shogun's retainer in the end of Edo period and a member of Kaitentai from Edo, Musashi Province.
Later, he joined Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).
Later, he joined Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).
sen.cmt: joined の前のスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Later, he joined Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).
嚮導役.
march leader
march leader
His family name is usually spelled 粕屋, but there is another theory that it was 糟屋.
His family name is usually spelled 粕屋, but there is another theory that it was 糟屋.
His family name is usually spelled 粕屋, but there is another theory that it was 糟屋.

sen.j: 戊辰戦争時、回天隊隊士として各地を転戦後、蝦夷地へ渡る。
sen.e: During the Boshin War, he moved from place to place to fight as a member of Kaitentai, and then he went to Ezo.
During the Boshin War, he moved from place to place to fight as a member of Kaitentai, and then he went to Ezo.
During the Boshin War, he moved from place to place to fight as a member of Kaitentai, and then he went to Ezo.

sen.j: 明治2年1月、箱館で土方歳三配下の新選組に入隊。
sen.e: In February 1869, he joined Shinsengumi under control of Toshizo HIJIKATA in Hakodate.
In February 1869, he joined Shinsengumi under control of Toshizo HIJIKATA in Hakodate.
In February 1869, he joined Shinsengumi under control of Toshizo HIJIKATA in Hakodate.

sen.j: 箱館戦争における箱館総攻撃により、新政府軍上陸地寒川で戦死。
sen.e: In the all-out assault of Hakodate in the Hakodate War, he was killed in Sangawa, where the New government army landed.
In the all-out assault of Hakodate in the Hakodate War, he was killed in Samugawa, where the New government army landed.
sen.cmt: 寒川を Samugawa としました。
sen.e: In the all-out assault of Hakodate in the Hakodate War, he was killed in Samugawa, where the New government army landed.
Died at 30.
Died at 30.
Died at 30.
